questions.skill: Interpret slope and y-intercept in context
questions.question: A phone plan charges a monthly fee plus a rate per gigabyte of data used. The equation C = 25 + 10d represents the total monthly cost C, in dollars, for using d gigabytes of data. What does the 25 represent in this equation?
questions.correct_answer: The fixed monthly fee in dollars
wrong_answers: The cost per gigabyte of data
The total number of gigabytes included
questions.explanation: In the equation C = 25 + 10d, the constant 25 is the y-intercept, representing the cost when d = 0 (no data used). This is the fixed monthly fee. The 10 is the slope, representing the cost per gigabyte.
